author: arnetheduck
content: <@194432762315407360> we started digging around but do not let it hold you up - there's an easy way to make the encrypted packets quic-lookalike by giving the packet an appropriate header which would reduce the IV to 12 bytes (using a short packet header with  0x1d packet type)

author: arnetheduck
content: there also exists an option to go for the long header and make every packet look like a handshake - this can have an interesting effect on anyone trying to sniff packets: it would look to the sniffer as if a new connection attempt is being made every time, which probably would ruin the connection table of any such tool, potentially breaking the naive ones
